channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Georgia Gov. Kemp says he won't for the U.S. Senate in next year's midterm
item.description: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp says he is passing on running for the U..S Senate in next year's midterm elections, a blow to Republicans who spent months courting him to challenge Democratic incumbent.

item.title: Key ruling could finally end North Carolina court election
item.description: Six months after the election, a federal judge has ordered that a contest for the North Carolina should finally be over, in a case that targeted thousands of votes on technical grounds.

item.title: A contentious hearing on the Hill for VA secretary
item.description: For the first time since his confirmation, Secretary of VA Doug Collins appeared before the Senate VA committee, after three months of controversial VA policy announcements.

item.title: Good news for the adorable axolotl â€” ones born in captivity could survive in the wild
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with scientist Alejandra Ramos, who just led a study about axolotls born in captivity who were released into the wild and survived.

item.title: Why oil prices are falling, and what it means for the economy
item.description: Between tariffs roiling the global economy and OPEC putting more barrels on the market, prices have dropped significantly since January. That's good for consumers, and bad for oil companies.

item.title: 'Weird Al' grapples with the complicated feelings of watching his daughter grow up
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Weird Al" Yankovic grapples with the complicated feelings of watching his daughter grow up.

item.title: India launches missile attacks on Pakistan
item.description: India has launched strikes in several parts of Pakistan and Pakistan-controlled territory, in a dramatic escalation of tensions between the two nuclear-armed rivals.

item.title: Tips on getting the most from deep reading
item.description: NPR's Life Kit team offers tips for how to read deeply in an age when we are constantly distracted.

item.title: This priest has advocated for LGBTQ Catholics. Here's what he thinks of the conclave
item.description: Pope Francis worked to make the Catholic Church more open to the LGBTQ community. NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with the Rev. James Martin about what direction the new pontiff could take the church.

item.title: Only three years old, online publication Baltimore Banner wins Pulitzer
item.description: Three reporters from the Baltimore Banner - a relatively new publication -- won a Pulitzer for their reporting on the overdose crisis in Baltimore done in conjunction with the New York Times.
